meanings.definition: A person or thing regarded as a perfect example of a particular quality.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero was seen as a paragon of bravery.
meanings.sent2: She was considered a paragon of kindness by everyone in the village.
meanings.sent3: The paragon of patience, the teacher calmly explained the lesson for the tenth time.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a paragon of beauty, with flowers blooming in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood as a paragon of strength, weathering many storms over the years.

meanings.definition: A model of excellence or perfection.
meanings.sent1: The new sports car was a paragon of speed and luxury.
meanings.sent2: The painting was considered a paragon of artistic skill and creativity.
meanings.sent3: The paragon of organization, her desk was always neat and tidy.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a paragon of eloquence, captivating the audience with every word.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in a paragon of colors, creating a breathtaking view.
